channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Man behind the term ‘presenteeism’ says bosses ordering workers back to the office are ‘the dinosaurs of our age’
item.description: A work psychology guru says Amazon's RTO mandate goes against the evidence and won't improve productivity.

item.title: Wednesday's analyst calls: Goldman says Marriott is a buy, apparel stock to pop 20%
item.description: A hotel giant and an apparel name were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Wednesday.

item.title: Why Trump could face lawsuits if he sells 'DJT' shares after saying he wouldn't
Introducing the first Fortune LGBTQ+ Leaders list
item.description: Today we celebrate the leaders who have bravely blazed a trail, leaving the path clear for the next generation.

item.title: Novartis not joining the 'frenzy' of weight loss drugs, CEO says
item.description: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Novartis said Wednesday that it does not plan to enter into the "frenzy" of weight loss drugs.

item.title: Trump floats nixing the SALT cap. Voters in these 6 states would benefit most.
45,000 longshoremen at key U.S. ports threaten to strike over automation and wages
item.description: The move would shut down ports that handle about half the nation's cargo from ships.

item.title: Google wins court challenge to the EU's $1.7 billion antitrust fine over ad product

item.title: Amazon wants staff back in the office 5 days a week — but WFH is here to stay
Michael Kors admits defeat by influencers and celebrities, claiming ‘brand fatigue’ in $8.5 billion federal antitrust trial
item.description: The FTC is attempting to block Tapestry’s acquisition of Capri, which would create a bag behemoth.

item.title: Tupperware files for bankruptcy as its colorful containers lose relevance
item.description: Tupperware listed $500 million to $1 billion in estimated assets and $1 billion to $10 billion in estimated liabilities, according to bankruptcy filin...

item.title: Blue chips lag as U.S. stocks edge upward ahead of Fed rate decision
Randstad CEO: Coming out at work was crucial for my career—but I was lucky
item.description: 'Coming out at work was a pivotal moment in my career,' writes Randstad CEO Sander van ‘t Noordende.

item.title: UK inflation holds steady in August, matching expectations
item.description: U.K. inflation came in at 2.2% for the month of August, data from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

item.title: Oil rises after exploding-pagers attack on Hezbollah operatives in Lebanon
